JarOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream,jav.Description: Creates a new JarOutputStream with the specified Manifest. The manifest is written as the first entry to the output stream.

Throws: if an I/O error has occurred
JarOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream).Description: Creates a new JarOutputStream with no manifest.

Parameters: ZipEntry: the ZIP/JAR entry to be written
Throws: if a ZIP error has occurred
if an I/O error has occurred
putNextEntry(java.util.zip.ZipEntry).Description: Begins writing a new JAR file entry and positions the stream to the start of the entry data. This method will also close any previous entry. The default compression method will be used if no compression method was specified for the entry. The current time will be used if the entry has no set modification time.

ClassDesc: The JarOutputStream class is used to write the contents of a JAR file to any output stream. It extends the class java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream with support for writing an optional Manifest entry. The Manifest can be used to specify meta-information about the JAR file and its entries.
